intro: Elaeosticta transitoria, commonly known as the transient elaeosticta, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its delicate, showy flowers that bloom briefly during the warm season. Its leaves are palmately lobed and often have a velvety texture. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
